Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.pathGeneration

Class MathFunctions

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.pathGeneration.MathFunctions
public class MathFunctions extends Object
This is the MathFunctions class. This contains many useful math related methods that I use in other classes to simplify code elsewhere.

  • Method Details

    • nCr

      public static double nCr(int n, int r)
      This is a simple implementation of the choose function in math. It's equivalent to the number of ways you can choose r items from n total items, if only which items got picked and not the order of picking the items mattered.
      Parameters:
      n - this is how many you want to choose from.
      r - this is how many you want to choose.
      Returns:
      returns the result of the "n choose r" function.

    • getSign

      public static double getSign(double get)
      This returns the sign (positive/negative) of a number.
      Parameters:
      get - the number.
      Returns:
      returns the sign of the number.

    • clamp

      public static double clamp(double num, double lower, double upper)
      This clamps down a value to between the lower and upper bounds inclusive.
      Parameters:
      num - the number to be clamped.
      lower - the lower bound.
      upper - the upper bound.
      Returns:
      returns the clamped number.

    • normalizeAngle

      public static double normalizeAngle(double angleRadians)
      This normalizes an angle to be between 0 and 2 pi radians, inclusive. IMPORTANT NOTE: This method operates in radians.
      Parameters:
      angleRadians - the angle to be normalized.
      Returns:
      returns the normalized angle.

    • getSmallestAngleDifference

      public static double getSmallestAngleDifference(double one, double two)
      This returns the smallest angle between two angles. This operates in radians.
      Parameters:
      one - one of the angles.
      two - the other one.
      Returns:
      returns the smallest angle.

    • getTurnDirection

      public static double getTurnDirection(double startHeading, double endHeading)
      This gets the direction to turn between a start heading and an end heading. Positive is left and negative is right. This operates in radians.
      Returns:
      returns the turn direction.

    • distance

      public static double distance(Pose pose, Point point)
      This returns the distance between a Pose and a Point,
      Parameters:
      pose - this is the Pose.
      point - this is the Point.
      Returns:
      returns the distance between the two.

    • distance

      public static double distance(Pose one, Pose two)
      This returns the distance between a Pose and another Pose.
      Parameters:
      one - this is the first Pose.
      two - this is the second Pose.
      Returns:
      returns the distance between the two.

    • addPoints

      public static Point addPoints(Point one, Point two)
      This returns a Point that is the sum of the two input Point.
      Parameters:
      one - the first Point
      two - the second Point
      Returns:
      returns the sum of the two Points.

    • addPoses

      public static Pose addPoses(Pose one, Pose two)
      This returns a Pose that is the sum of the two input Pose.
      Parameters:
      one - the first Pose
      two - the second Pose
      Returns:
      returns the sum of the two Pose.

    • subtractPoints

      public static Point subtractPoints(Point one, Point two)
      This subtracts the second Point from the first Point and returns the result as a Point. Do note that order matters here.
      Parameters:
      one - the first Point.
      two - the second Point.
      Returns:
      returns the difference of the two Points.

    • subtractPoses

      public static Pose subtractPoses(Pose one, Pose two)
      This subtracts the second Pose from the first Pose and returns the result as a Pose. Do note that order matters here.
      Parameters:
      one - the first Pose.
      two - the second Pose.
      Returns:
      returns the difference of the two Pose.

      public static Point scalarMultiplyPoint(Point point, double scalar)
      This multiplies a Point by a scalar and returns the result as a Point
      Parameters:

      scalar - the scalar multiplying into the Point.
      Returns:
      returns the scaled Point.

    • copyPoint

      public static Point copyPoint(Point point)
      Copies a Point, but with a different reference location in the memory. So basically a deep copy.
      Parameters:
      point - the Point to be deep copied.
      Returns:
      returns the copied Point.

    • copyVector

      public static Vector copyVector(Vector vector)
      Copies a Vector, but with a different reference location in the memory. So basically a deep copy.
      Parameters:
      vector - Vector to be deep copied.
      Returns:
      returns the copied Vector.

    • scalarMultiplyVector

      public static Vector scalarMultiplyVector(Vector vector, double scalar)
      This multiplies a Vector by a scalar and returns the result as a Vector.
      Parameters:
      vector - the Vector being multiplied.
      scalar - the scalar multiplying into the Vector.
      Returns:
      returns the scaled Vector.

    • normalizeVector

      public static Vector normalizeVector(Vector vector)
      This normalizes a Vector to be of magnitude 1, unless the Vector is the zero Vector. In that case, it just returns back the zero Vector but with a different memory location.
      Parameters:
      vector - the Vector being normalized.
      Returns:
      returns the normalized (or zero) Vector.

    • addVectors

      public static Vector addVectors(Vector one, Vector two)
      This returns a Vector that is the sum of the two input Vectors.
      Parameters:
      one - the first Vector.
      two - the second Vector.
      Returns:
      returns the sum of the Vectors.

    • subtractVectors

      public static Vector subtractVectors(Vector one, Vector two)
      This subtracts the second Vector from the first Vector and returns the result as a Vector. Do note that order matters here.
      Parameters:
      one - the first Vector.
      two - the second Vector.
      Returns:
      returns the second Vector subtracted from the first Vector.

    • dotProduct

      public static double dotProduct(Vector one, Vector two)
      This computes the dot product of the two Vectors.
      Parameters:
      one - the first Vector.
      two - the second Vector.
      Returns:
      returns the dot product of the two Vectors.

    • crossProduct

      public static double crossProduct(Vector one, Vector two)
      This computes the first Vector crossed with the second Vector, so a cross product. Do note that order matters here.
      Parameters:
      one - the first Vector.
      two - the second Vector.
      Returns:
      returns the cross product of the two Vectors.

    • roughlyEquals

      public static boolean roughlyEquals(double one, double two, double accuracy)
      This returns whether a specified value is within a second specified value by plus/minus a specified accuracy amount.
      Parameters:
      one - first number specified.
      two - second number specified.
      accuracy - the level of accuracy specified.
      Returns:
      returns if the two numbers are within the specified accuracy of each other.

    • roughlyEquals

      public static boolean roughlyEquals(double one, double two)
      This returns whether a specified number is within a second specified number by plus/minus 0.0001.
      Parameters:
      one - first number specified.
      two - second number specified.
      Returns:
      returns if a specified number is within plus/minus 0.0001 of the second specified number.
